description: Borrowed from Latin puerpera (“woman in labor or childbed”), substantive of puerperus (“parturient, bringing forth children”), from puer (“child, boy”) +‎ pariō (“to bring forth, bear”) +‎ -us (adjectival suffix).

entries.meaning: (obstetrics) A woman undergoing puerperium; a woman whose uterus is still enlarged from pregnancy.
(rare) A woman who has recently given birth.
